dialogue.text: The...same thing I always call you? Sensei.
What's going on? Did you have a bad dream or something?
I guess so...
Do you want me to call the nurse or something? You seem a little flushed.
Come a little closer so I can touch your forehead and find out.
I'm fine...I think I just need a few minutes to collect myself or something.
Excuse me for asking this so abruptly, but-
What the fuck is going on right now?
Who is this girl? Or, better question, who am {i}I?{/i}
Why can't I remember anything?...
This classroom seems vaguely familiar, but...
But it's like each time I try to piece things together, I just circle back around and give up before I'm able to get anywhere.
This girl should probably know something, right?
But...if she's my student, she'll probably only know things that a {i}student{/i} would know. She'll have no idea who I am or...where I even live or-
Wait, where am I supposed to go after I leave here when I still have absolutely no clue where I am?
Um...are you sure you're okay? You're looking a little...panicky.
I'm just...tired, I think.
Still? Even after sleeping through the entire last period?
Yeah, sorry. Long night, I guess.
Long night? But we were together the whole time.
I'm sorry, what?
Am I...dating a teenager?
Okay, seriously. What's going on with you? You're acting like you don't even recognize your own niece.
Oh. So that's how it is.
Well, that is significantly less exciting. But at least I should be able to leverage that role to...try and make sense of what's going on here.
At the very least, if we're related, she'll probably know where I live.
Of course I recognize you. I'm just feeling a little out of it right now.
Well, do you think going home might help? Because it doesn't seem like sticking around school is helping you at all right now.
Yeah, but...do you think you might be able to come with me? I could probably use the help since I'm still...you know, regaining my footing and whatnot.
Why would I not come with you? We literally live together.
Oh. Right. I forgot.
Well, at least my first five minutes in what I'm assuming is some sort of...alternate reality or something have been filled almost entirely with convenient coincidences.
That has to be what this is, right? Some sort of...reincarnation type thing?
Wait, doesn't this mean that I must have died, though?
Just what the hell is happening to me all of a sudden?
How can you just {i}forget{/i} that we've been living together for years?
What's next? Are you going to tell me you've forgotten my name?
Oh my God! You {i}have{/i} forgotten my name, haven't you?!
It's Ami, Sensei! {i}Ami!{/i}
Sorry. It's nothing personal...probably.
Probably?!
To be completely honest, I'm having a hard time remembering literally anything right now. So...I'll probably be leaning on you for help for a little while.
I mean...helping you is pretty much all I do in the first place, so I'm happy to do whatever you need me to.
But if your memories are really that jumbled, shouldn't we take you to a doctor or something?
You're old, but I didn't realize you were old enough to start dealing with that dementia thingy.
I'm not {i}that{/i} old, am I?
This body feels mostly healthy and well put together, so I can't imagine I'm any older than my 30's.
I guess not. You're actually one of the youngest teachers we have, I think.
But if there's something wrong with your brain, we should act now. Because if anything bad ever happened to you, I'd probably just die too.
That seems...excessive.
Well, if your memories really are gone, you'll be finding out very soon that that's just the type of girl I am!
Or you're just lying about all of this because you hate me and want to play a weird prank on me, but I'll play along either way!
Helping you round up your memories sounds kinda fun, actually. It's like we're characters inside of a manga now or something.
Yeah...or something.
I wonder how it'll end. Normally, all of the stuff where the main character loses his memories ends up being kinda depressing by the last volume.
I think there are more pressing matters at hand than figuring out how things are going to {i}end{/i} right now.
Right, right. We've gotta get you back home since you can't remember where you live without me.
You know, Sensei, if you want to spend more time with me, all you have to do is ask. You don't have to fake amnesia just for my attention.
Well, please forgive me if I continue to {i}fake{/i} it for a little while longer.
Because at this point, I still have no idea what I'm supposed to do...
Ami spins around and I instinctively leave my desk to follow her, like it's something I've done time and time before.
It's not, though.
This isn't my life.
It can't be.
Because no one would ever look at me the way she does if this is where I'm meant to be.
Without even knowing myself yet, I understand that much.
For as she pulls me through the halls of the school by my wrist, my mind ventures forth to forbidden territories-
And it encircles itself in possibilities and fantasies I will not yet reveal to you.
If I did, I can't imagine you'd stay to observe me much longer.
But I suppose I don't even know who {i}you{/i} are...or who I'm even aiming these thoughts at right now.
Perhaps-
Well...perhaps they don't need to be aimed anywhere at all.
And perhaps I'm content with just imagining someone is there as it makes daydreaming all the less lonely.
